reviews.review_msg: Faezeh is an incredible professor. I can tell that she genuinely cares about her students from her responses. Always ready to answer questions no matter how long it takes and highly responsive. It is impressive that it's her first time teaching a course here at SFU. Wish her the best.

went over the topics patiently, which I appreciated since stat is not my major. No exams, just 85% on assignments and if you attend tutorial you can get full mark. There is few pop quizes but most of the questions are very easy and from that lec. So attend lectures and honestly you can get an A easily just by attending class without much reading.

Dr Yazdi is very caring and super kind prof. I wish I could say that to more SFU profs. She put 3 additional office hours to help students and was always accommodating for submission delays or questions. While it was her first time teaching, she helped me understand linear algb concepts I couldn't understand from Math240. I recommend taking her!!
She reads and teaches super slow. Easily fall asleep in class...

Had her for 330 as well and she was solid for both. Final was very difficult but the rest of the course was fairly straightforward. A good introduction to the topics of multivariate analysis. A good choice here.

Her English isn't great and the lectures were confusing. Tutorial was even worse. I found her notes to be disorganized as well. The textbook is ok, but more detailed than what you need to know. Assignments are best way to learn the material and similar questions will be on the exams. She explains things better in person, go to her office hours.
She is responsible and helpful for students. Exams were not hard. All the thing you need is understand her notes and do assignments your own. Textbook is not necessary.
